str2: A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
Early dawn, day-break. From the same as oros; dawn; by extension, morn.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter of hieros; a sacred place, i.e. The entire precincts of the Temple.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To teach, direct, admonish. A prolonged form of a primary verb dao; to teach.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
High priest, chief priest. From arche and hiereus; the high-priest; by extension a chief priest.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From para and ginomai; to become near, i.e. Approach; by implication, to appear publicly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A council, tribunal; the Sanhedrin, the meeting place of the Sanhedrin.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To call together. From sun and kaleo; to convoke.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The assembly or body of elders. From geron; the eldership, i.e. the Jewish Sanhedrin.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Of Hebrew origin; Israel, the adopted name of Jacob, including his descendants.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A prison. From a derivative of desmon; a place of bondage, i.e. A dungeon.
A primary verb; properly, to lead; by implication, to bring, drive, go, pass, or induce.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
